page.title: 08A COUNTRY WALK
page.content: We start at Cheswick Green school on Cheswick Way, where we see some new houses being built.We go down Creynolds Lane and see lots of new houses, on the left are fields. There's a small, old bridge with a shallow steam underneath.We turn right into Vicarage Road and on this road is a big house,the Vicarage.Now we turn left into Salter Street,which has a big church called St.Patricks Church with the church school beside it.We turn left into Limekiln Lane where there's a pub called The Bull's Head and an old,pretty cottage built in 1911.We turn into Warings Green Road where we'll see a canal with a pub next to it.We turn left onto Illshaw Heath Road where there are fields and modern houses.We turn left into Cheswick Way and we are back where we began.
